original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge up on banks and blue chip counters
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka‘s shares edged up in mid day trade on Thursday, Colombo Stock Exchange data showed.
“Buying interest was seen in blue chip counters and the banking sector, because concerns have been lifted with regard to debt optimization and macroeconomic factors,” an analyst said.
The main All Share Price Index was up 1.26 percent or 137.90 points to 11,122.98, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was up 1.80 percent or 57.13 points to 3,224.51.
Top gainers during mid day trade were John Keells Holdings, Commercial Bank & Hatton National Bank.
The market generated a turnover of 1.4 billion rupees. (Colombo/July27/2023)
